hotel_name: Ann Siang House, The Unlimited Collection by Oakwood
review_title: “Nice boutique hotel, good location, spacious suite.”
review_pos: Very pleasant stay in Ann Siang House. We chose the wellness suite, not for the wellness stuff, but for the nice location on the second floor, facing the beautiful historic street. Also for the large balcony. Unfortunately it was far too hot to sit outside, but the suite is so spacious that we didn’t miss it. Nicely furbished, very good bed and marvelous bathroom with toilet, bath, walk in shower and two bathroom sinks.The kitchenette comes with kettle, coffee machine, induction cooktop, microwave, small fridge and very few kitchenware. There was a saucepan and a frying pan, plates, cups, bowls and cutlery for two. No need to cook however, there are several restaurants in the hotel and the Maxwell Hawker center is just a few steps away. The minibar is free with soft drinks, sparkling and still water. There is a choice of coffee and teas. Nice and silent airco in the sleeping area and the living room. The bathroom has no airco, but we didn’t miss it. Breakfast is ok. There is no abundance, but the food is of good quality and there is everything one needs to start the day: good coffee, bread, eggs, sausage, brie, jam, muffins etc.We were warned there would be some noise from the street at night. It’s a lively street with restaurants, bars and terraces, so that’s normal. The noise is bearable during week days. Friday night was quite intense, with loud music, but at exactly 1:30 am the music stopped. Ann Siang house is a great place to stay. The staff is very friendly. We might come again another year.
review_neg: The suite was very clean, however the carpet showed a lot of big stains. Depending from the moment of the day, we had very poor internet or no internet at all. Other moments we had a better coverage.
review_tags: Leisure trip,Couple,The Wellbeing Suite,Stayed 1 night

hotel_name: PARKROYAL COLLECTION Pickering, Singapore - SG Clean, Staycation Approved
review_pos: Located about 20 minutes drive away from the Changi international airport in Singapore, the PARKROYAL COLLECTION Pickering is a 5-star, eco-friendly hotel. Known for its award-winning 'hotel-in-a-garden' design which incorporates elevated terraced gardens, green walls, water features, solar cells, and rainwater harvesting, PARKROYAL COLLECTION Pickering offers a rejuvenating escape in the midst of the city.Ambience at PARKROYAL COLLECTION Pickering is the highlight of any stay here. Surrounded by lush greenery despite the urban setting, the hotel is an oasis of escape. With high ceilings and water features around, the place exudes a calm tranquility, setting the mind at ease. Wood decor and energy efficient features complete the sustainable experience. The facade looks sleek yet welcoming, with ample greenery and water ponds flanking the walkway. Temperature taking is performed only at the main entry, so other entrances are currently closed.Rooms at PARKROYAL COLLECTION Pickering are large and relaxing. I stayed at the COLLECTION Lifestyle Room, which has a comfortable king bed and sofa. The working desk is decently sized, complete with an ergonomic Herman Miller sayl chair. The floor-to-ceiling windows allow ample natural light, but there are no views because of the ample landscaping outside. The bathroom is stocked with amenities, and there's a choice of multi-function shower or bathtub. The high-speed internet wifi is stable, but the cable television has limited channels.
review_neg: Service at PARKROYAL COLLECTION Pickering is inconsistent, with the lower numbers of staff sometimes struggling to keep pace with the demand. Bags took 1.5 hours to arrive at the room after check-in, and there was disorganised confusion in which bag to be delivered to which room. On a particular afternoon, staff seated us in the lounge, but forgot to offer anything, leaving us sitting there without any menu, drinks, or tidbits. There was poor service recovery when a guest was unable to get a room on a high floor despite the request. All that said, staff were generally friendly and polite, and tried their best to manage difficult situations.

review_title: “Overall comfortable enough for a night's stay (but probably not longer)”
review_pos: Nice, clean hostel, located very near to BTS station.The lockers are spacious (but you need to bring your own lock).
review_neg: It seems they have a strict check-in time (2pm) . So if you arrive early, be prepared to wait with your luggage. [Other hostels do also, but they are usually flexible- they will allow you to check-in earlier if the rooms are ready]. Best to avoid arriving before 2pm if possible.The upper bunks have no railings or headboard. A restless sleeper who rolls over quite a lot may fall (possibly head first) and sustain a severe injury. The beds are quite large, so this may appear unlikely, but it may be a good idea anyway to avoid the upper bunks if possible. The latches on the bathroom doors are a bit oddly placed, and required a bit of a struggle to remove. If you find this happening, its possibly because you did not close the door completely before latching. But maybe it would be simpler if these could be changed to something more conventional.   The front counter is not manned 24 hours (I think it is 9am to 9pm). However, on check-in, they collect a 100 Baht deposit for the access card which is refundable. I am not sure how this refund is made if you have to leave before 9am. Staff seemed very absorbed on their phones on arrival; its a bit strange they don't notice you entering the building.
